text:
I got an invalid argument error exception from Oracle Driver with following 
configuration in server.xml file
      <Realm  className="org.apache.catalina.realm.JDBCRealm" debug="99"
             driverName="oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleDriver"
             connectionURL="jdbc:oracle:oci8:@xxx?
user=username:password=password"
          userTable="users" userNameCol="user_name" userCredCol="user_pass"
          userRoleTable="user_roles" roleNameCol="role_name" />

It worked fine with following configuration 

      <Realm  className="org.apache.catalina.realm.JDBCRealm" debug="99"
             driverName="oracle.jdbc.driver.OracleDriver"
          connectionURL="jdbc:oracle:oci8:@xxx"
           connectionName="xxxx"
           connectionPassword="xxxx"
          userTable="users" userNameCol="user_name" userCredCol="user_pass"
          userRoleTable="user_roles" roleNameCol="role_name" />
creator: pratech@yahoo.com

text:
There's an example with mySQL which uses that syntax. Passing params on the URL
is driver spefic, so here it doesn't work (Oracle undoubtedly has a special
syntax of its own). It probably would have been more appropriate to use the non
proprietary syntax.
creator: remm@apache.org
